ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yeah, definitely I will suggest it to another student. it's a must for a student studying atmosphere and ocean.
I recommend taking this course, because throughout the semester we could learn a wide range of topics and it helps understand the basics of atmospheric science quite well.
- Introductory course dealing with the physics and maths behind weather, and also a little bit of climate.- Definitely recommend.
I would definitely recommend this class to another student who is interested in the basics of the climate system. Good introductory course but some physics and calculus background really is a plus.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in taking a next step from basic earth science classes into the field of climatology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: the course is so useful. it helps a lot in extending the knowledge and organize a system of this knowledge.
It reinforced my understanding of my profession. It became my fundamental knowledge in my research.
- Got me started off with the knowledge requiredfor the study of atmospheric thermodynamics and dynamics.

This class is a bit outside my main research area but it'll be great foundations for my research. While it doesn't directly apply I know this class will benefit me by providing context for my research and during qualifying exam questions potentially.
